revised_title: Vibration-Rotation Band of Deuterium Chloride: Molecular Constants and Isotopic Comparisons
tldr: The authors re-examined the fundamental vibration-rotation band of deuterium chloride using a lead telluride photoconductive cell in a grating spectrometer, achieving higher resolving power than previous studies. They determined rotational constants for the two combining states and obtained values for the centrifugal stretching constants. The results show a high degree of agreement with other isotopic molecules and provide secondary wavelength standards for the spectral region.
